page.title: 02Life in 1905-Welshampton
page.content: There were many small industries in the village in 1905,there was a bakery and it was owned by Mr. Evans,a dress makers that was owned by Miss. Evans,a blacksmith and taylor that was owned by Mr. Watson and a carpenters.Most of the men worked on the land or the railway and canal. The road surfaces were rough then with just stones and broken cobbles hand picked out of fields.The only traffic was horsedrawn. Many of the outbuildings adjoining the Sun public house have been demolished. Ladies in those days wore long skirts and blouses,boots and always a hat.The men wore corduroy trousers,cloth jackets and heavy boots with plates and studs.The families then were much larger.Entertainment was of the homespun variety. Following an interview with Mrs Steele aged 92.
